results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/04]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. A thousand sails under a cupola - the Paris Pleasure-Boating salon. 2. French victories: Rugby - France versus Scotland at Murrayfield. Swiss skiing competition. 3. Universal medicine - a veterinary institute for the USSR. 4. The Bolchoi in Paris - the famed USSR troupe takes over the Paris Opera. 5. The art adventure - artist Yves Brayer has other muses besides painting, as he explains to sculptor Belmondo.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/52]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Modern city planning - a bird’s eye-view of new trends in France’s housing developments. 2. The big problem of youth - old and new methods of checking and testing the physical and psychological aptitudes of France’s recruits. Visit to Vincennes’ new “Selection Center No. 1”. 3. Today’s theatre - in Paris, the old Sarah Bernhardt Theatre is replaced by the “ultra-modern” City Theatre run by Jean Mercure. 4. Ushering out the old year: Christmas at the Palais de l’Elysee. Yuletide Paris Circus Gala.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/49]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The St. Louis Hospital in Paris. 2. The gypsies - on the long road, they live in a world apart. 3. The Finest Toys in the World - dedicated to the protection of children. 4. The “Montgolfiere” style - an historical overview of ballooning. 5. Mizrahi - space-age sculptures from raw materials by Jacques Mizrahi. 6. Paul Klee - the biggest retrospective of the works of Paul Klee since that of 1948 recently opened at Paris’ Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/47]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Vers le Paris o’lan 2000 (Paris of the year 2000) - Anb old suburb of Paris makes way for new buildings, subway and shopping centre. 2.ichel Blareff - a French pop star in action. 3. L’art Flamand contemporan a l’Orangerie (Contemporary Flemish art at Orangerie Museum) - Flanders a hot-bed of artists - Van Eyck, Rubens, James Ensore a modern contemporary currently on display. 4. La nature et l’homme (1970 is European nature presentation year) - Shows air pollution in the cities and increases in CO2 from aircraft etc; oil spills in the sea; crop spraying. 5. The Paris Observatory - Oldest still in service. Shows museum collection and modern equipment. 6. In memory of D’Ambroise Pare, the father of surgery (1585), henry II’s surgeon. 7. Painters as witnesses of their time - art and work 20th century depictions of people working.
